div1.head: Jim to Mademoiselle Marcelle Guerin April 20th 1916
div1.p:
We arrived at Luxeuil last evening after a strange and varied trip, during which we went to Rosnay, where we found orders were wrong, and we should have gone to Luxeuil; then in a special machine we were taken to Rheims and then Epernay. At Lure our Captain, who is a fine chap, met us in one of our touring cars and motored us to aviation camp here. “Sixty two pilots were killed last month” was his cheerful greeting. Then we were taken to meet Captaine Att. This jovial soul was rubbing his hands and arranging eight little boxes containing Croix de Guerre (sl. [sic] “For the families of those killed on our last trip” said he smiling.
“You see there’s lots of work.”

Well our machines won’t be here for a week and so we’ve got a few days left us to enjoy life. And so we are doing. We have splendid quarters; eat with the Capt. and Lieutenant at the best hotel and have an orderly to shine shoes take care of rooms and arrange for our baths which we take at the famous springs next door to us. C’est dure cette sale Guerre!” The main trouble is that we’re 65 kilometers from the lines and that’s too far for an escadrille de chasse. We expect that we will form
here, get in some work and then move on. Our escadrille has a beautiful equipment. // new Fiat Canions [sp?], two staff card, 4 trucks and all sorts of tents, etc. There are over 70 men in the escadrille and, as at present, we are but ten pilots, including the Captain and Lieutenant, you see being a pilot is quite a comfortable feeling. In the ambulance I was a driver and did repairs and ran around on orders. Here we have the driver come for us; an adjutant sees that our orderly does what we want and for the first few days its hard to get used
to, especially after being a 2nd class soldier at Pau. The whole thing reminds me somewhat of the custom in ancient days of treating a man like a king before the sacrifice of his blood to the Gods. But I don’t care what the motive is so long as the treatment lasts. What I want is to get a chance at some Boches and I’d trade em [sic] all the comfort for that.
